trans-unit.source: Walkthrough: Activate the latest SQL Database Update V12
trans-unit.target: Walkthrough: Activate the latest SQL Database Update V12

trans-unit.source: Describes the steps for trying the V12 version of Azure SQL Database, by using the new Microsoft Azure portal UI.
trans-unit.target: Describes the steps for trying the V12 version of Azure SQL Database, by using the new Microsoft Azure portal UI.

trans-unit.source: Walkthrough: Activate the Latest SQL Database Update V12
trans-unit.target: Walkthrough: Activate the Latest SQL Database Update V12

trans-unit.source: This topic describes the steps you can follow to activate the Azure SQL Database V12 option, as first released by Microsoft in December 2014.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes the steps you can follow to activate the Azure SQL Database V12 option, as first released by Microsoft in December 2014.

trans-unit.source: To try the latest V12 you first need a subscription to Microsoft Azure, or at least a <link><linkText>free trial</linkText><title></title></link> subscription.
trans-unit.target: To try the latest V12 you first need a subscription to Microsoft Azure, or at least a <link><linkText>free trial</linkText><title></title></link> subscription.

trans-unit.source: You can activate V12 by using the new Azure preview portal at <link><linkText>http://portal.azure.com/</linkText><title></title></link>, instead of the <link><linkText>older Azure portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: You can activate V12 by using the new Azure preview portal at <link><linkText>http://portal.azure.com/</linkText><title></title></link>, instead of the <link><linkText>older Azure portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: After you activate V12 for your subscription, the create and upgrade options for V12 become unlocked in the Azure preview portal.
trans-unit.target: After you activate V12 for your subscription, the create and upgrade options for V12 become unlocked in the Azure preview portal.

trans-unit.source: Then users can initiate the <link><linkText>create</linkText><title></title></link> workflow from the server blade or the database blade.
trans-unit.target: Then users can initiate the <link><linkText>create</linkText><title></title></link> workflow from the server blade or the database blade.

trans-unit.source: Test databases, database copies, or new databases, are good candidates for upgrading to the preview.
trans-unit.target: Test databases, database copies, or new databases, are good candidates for upgrading to the preview.

trans-unit.source: Production databases that your business depends on should wait until after the preview period.
trans-unit.target: Production databases that your business depends on should wait until after the preview period.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the upgrade to V12, see <link><linkText>Plan and Prepare to Upgrade to Azure SQL Database V12</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the upgrade to V12, see <link><linkText>Plan and Prepare to Upgrade to Azure SQL Database V12</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: A. Security authorization
trans-unit.target: A. Security authorization

trans-unit.source: The first step is to ensure that you have sufficient authorization to activate V12 for your subscription.
trans-unit.target: The first step is to ensure that you have sufficient authorization to activate V12 for your subscription.

trans-unit.source: When you attempt to activate the V12 option, an authorization check is performed to verify you have sufficient authority within the subscription.
trans-unit.target: When you attempt to activate the V12 option, an authorization check is performed to verify you have sufficient authority within the subscription.

trans-unit.source: To try V12 you must have one of the following authorizations:
trans-unit.target: To try V12 you must have one of the following authorizations:

trans-unit.source: The subscription owner
trans-unit.target: The subscription owner

trans-unit.source: A co-administrator of the subscription
trans-unit.target: A co-administrator of the subscription

trans-unit.source: For more information about Azure accounts, see <link><linkText>Manage Accounts, Subscriptions, and Administrative Roles</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about Azure accounts, see <link><linkText>Manage Accounts, Subscriptions, and Administrative Roles</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: B. Steps in the Azure preview portal UI
trans-unit.target: B. Steps in the Azure preview portal UI

trans-unit.source: This section describes a click sequence that you can follow one time in the Azure preview portal UI to activate V12 option.
trans-unit.target: This section describes a click sequence that you can follow one time in the Azure preview portal UI to activate V12 option.

trans-unit.source: After you activate the option, it remains available thereafter.
trans-unit.target: After you activate the option, it remains available thereafter.

trans-unit.source: All the activation scenarios use the same basic idea.
trans-unit.target: All the activation scenarios use the same basic idea.

trans-unit.source: When you first try to create a new SQL Database server, a blade labeled Latest Update (preview) is displayed that offers a check box that you can select to activate your privilege to use V12 version.
trans-unit.target: When you first try to create a new SQL Database server, a blade labeled Latest Update (preview) is displayed that offers a check box that you can select to activate your privilege to use V12 version.

trans-unit.source: After you activate the privilege, you never see the check box again.
trans-unit.target: After you activate the privilege, you never see the check box again.

trans-unit.source: Instead you see a Yes|No control you can use to specify whether you want your new server to use V12.
trans-unit.target: Instead you see a Yes|No control you can use to specify whether you want your new server to use V12.

trans-unit.source: If you choose No, you create a V11 server (as reported by SELECT @@VERSION;).
trans-unit.target: If you choose No, you create a V11 server (as reported by SELECT @@VERSION;).

trans-unit.source: B.1 Yes|No control for the V12 version
trans-unit.target: B.1 Yes|No control for the V12 version

trans-unit.source: After you have activated the V12 option privilege, you see the Yes|No control that is circled in the following Azure preview portal screenshot.
trans-unit.target: After you have activated the V12 option privilege, you see the Yes|No control that is circled in the following Azure preview portal screenshot.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>YesNoOptionForTheV12Preview</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>YesNoOptionForTheV12Preview</linkText>

trans-unit.source: C. What's next
trans-unit.target: C. What's next

trans-unit.source: Next, the following topics explain ways you can use SQL Database V12.
trans-unit.target: Next, the following topics explain ways you can use SQL Database V12.

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Create a database in SQL Database Update V12</linkText><title></title></link>
